BP.term: G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway, coupled to cyclic nucleotide second messenger
adenylate cyclase-modulating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway
G protein-coupled serotonin receptor signaling pathway

name: 5-hydroxytryptamine receptor 6

smpdb.name: Excitatory Neural Signalling Through 5-HTR 6 and Serotonin

summary: This gene encodes a protein that belongs to the seven-transmembrane G protein-coupled receptor family of proteins. The encoded protein couples with the Gs alpha subunit and stimulates adenylate cyclase to activate the cyclic AMP-dependent signaling pathway. This receptor is thought to regulate cholinergic neuronal transmission in the brain. Several antidepressants and antipsychotic drugs have a high affinity for this receptor. [provided by RefSeq, Aug 2013].
